comments.commentBody:
Oh, Richard.

Challenging Trump to say he has read the Constitution is disrespectful. Methinks thou dost protest too much.

And while you're at the task of saying that the 1% (I saw 1.6% recently when I googled) of Muslims are too insignificant to rate the right to swagger, just bear in mind that when a certain Mr. Schicklgruber was going after the Jews in the German-speaking world, they represented less than 2% of the population of Germany and Austria. Maybe their protests were a level of political correctness a couple of galaxies too far, too.

Richard Luettgen,

Once again, Mr. Luettgen you so clearly demonstrate that you have no idea what minorities have and continue to go through in America and they you simply "don't get it"!

It is a shame that your forebears have not enlightened you.

Who said Trump didn't have the right to defend himself? Don't blame us if we viewed his defense as pathetic self pity and lashing out in bigotry. I welcomed his self-centered defense, which was the cause of the first major polling damage he experienced, completely self inflicted.   Please Donald, keep whining.

From what I’ve read American Muslims are trying hard to keep a low profile during this election. And who could blame them -- why would they wish to stir up bad feeling? After all, they number only about 1% of the U.S. population, hardly a number that is likely to make much of a difference in this election. Mr. Ali’s spirited if rather fierce insistence that his fellow faithful are not “Potato Head counterterrorism experts” (whatever in heaven does that mean?) probably elicits sympathy, but asserting rights “with swagger and demanding to be treated with fairness” sounds like a union get-together amply supplied with beer (yes, I recognize that beer probably isn’t the best image to conjure).

An increase of more than 30% in Muslim voter registration since 2012? What does that amount to? 50,000 across America? I can appreciate swagger, but it’s a little hard to take seriously numbers that might swing the election of county dead-animal-pickup commissioner, but not much else.

Khizr Khan is an interesting case. Trump certainly should have treated the family carefully, given a child who had died in the defense of America, but Mr. Kahn placed HIMSELF in the arena by attacking Trump in no uncertain terms – and certainly disrespectful ones – during the Democratic convention. What, Trump has no right to defend himself against such treatment?

All Americans should welcome American Muslim votes, whatever they be. But this op-ed takes political correctness about three galaxies too far.

Colin Powell and Condoleeza Rice had private servers. Do you think they are criminals too? Mrs. Clinton's knowledge of computer systems are not those of a computer expert. Does this make her a criminal?
Many people complain that the FBI plays a political role.  I think they should complain about the candidate who brought the FBI into politics by her irresponsible actions bordering on being criminal.

No, it's not realistic to think they found his computer, hacked in, added outlook accounts and 650K emails using Abedin's password, then posed as a 15-year-old girl for Wiener all so that in the unlikely event he was investigated and searched, that the FBI would release that letter to Congress. And all without leaving a trace.

Occam's Razor people...this theory is more ridiculous than Obama Birthers.

I'd like to know who put those emails on Anthony Wiener's laptop. Given the possibility of Russian interference, how hard would it be for Russian hackers to plant files over the internet? And what a logical target to pick. Especially when Anthony Wiener is so notorious - and married to Clinton's closest aide.

A bombshell new report says 28% of registered Republicans who voted early in Florida voted for Clinton.  28% That's extraordinary.  It was 6% in 2008 and 9% in 2012.  If Clinton wins Florida, she wins.  I guess Comey will be working for Clinton.  He better hope she doesn't bear a grudge.
It is so fitting that Hillary will just miss becoming the first woman president in the very last week due to sheer speculation of wrong doing.  Comey came through in the end.

Her stonewalling & deletions makes Hill responsible for a good portion of this ugly mess. A responsible civil servant would have allowed unfettered access to the investigators to do their due diligence.
She lost all right to privacy when she mixed her private with her governmental work.

I agree that transparency is necessary for a functioning democracy, but...

Comey heads the FBI and his job is to lead investigation, not to condemn anyone in the court of public opinion.

Comey's job requires secrecy. His job is not to be a spokesperson.

You can claim whatever you want about someone like Snowden, for instance, that some people claim was a fresh breath of transparency. However, the bottom line is that Snowden broke the law by releasing he information he knew about. Comey just had his Snowden day. Perhaps he too should hide under Putin's wings.
Ugly partisanship that seems to get worse every year makes Obama look foolish for trying to choose someone in a bipartisan manner.

This doesn't even make sense. This year more than ever party loyalty is wilting. I'm among 10  million (minimum) Democrats voting for Trump. No doubt enough religious right voters are voting for Hillary. My parents, who have voted Republican every election in their life are voting 3rd party. I don't care about party, I care about ideas.

In the end President Obama is to blame for choosing Republican James Comey to head the FBI. There were other very capable Democrats and Independents who could have done the job, yet Obama's naivety that he could work with Republicans persists even to his detriment.

As can be seen with their support for Trump, party always triumphs over country. A Republican, especially one serving a Democrat president, is loyal to a point; when the chips are down, they switch allegiance to party.

I do not believe that under similar circumstances, Comey would have sent a letter to Democrat leadership in Congress to the detriment of a Republican presidential candidate days before the election.

Innocent until proven guilty. Isn't that the refrain?

Whether or not Comey meant it, that email gave Republicans lots of ammo to distort, deceive and misconstrue. What did the email say? Just that there's some emails they want to take a look at. Might be pertinent. Might not be. But that's a guilty sentence in today's partisan politics, and an utter gift to the likes of Trump.

He should've followed protocol and waited to see if there was any fire behind all that smoke.

You don't know anything.Comey was appointed for 10 years beginning in 2013 so he's there no matter who wins the election.
You obviously didn't read the article or you're just not smart enough to comprehend it.
Let me guess,you're a Hillary supporter just because she squats to pee.That just shows your very low level of intelligence.

The server was legal, period.

That's like saying if a driver didn't get on the highway, they wouldn't have been followed for 200 miles in search of a lane violation.

And if Abel had fared differently in Genesis, things today would be more broadly different than they are.  But Abel was killed and here we are: cursed with an FBI director who poses as a man of high probity and stellar ethical standards only to find that he is a cat's paw for the Republicans.  At least he gives us a meretricious smile with his mendacity.

I disagree. Comey should have at least gotten the warrant and done a cursory search before dropping this bombshell, which basically said: "Um, we don't know anything except Clinton's name might be on some emails on Weiner's computer".
It is the Director's job to discern the difference between pertinent fact and meaningless fact. If he can't make that distinction professionally, and objectively, he's in the wrong job.

Clinton and Abedin put the FBI director in a no-win situation, and now they are blaming the victim. Had there been no private server in the basement. and no sharing of emails on a single computer accessed by both Abedin and Weiner, there would be no story here. Tens of millions of Americans would fervently like to rewrite the script so that would have been the way it went down, instead of this nightmare heading into Election Day.

Well, you've got the most racist, sexist candidate since anybody can remember and a politically charged atmosphere against law enforcement and the African American voter turnout is DOWN.

Does anything make sense in this election? No.

8 more days...

A lot of speculation, and maybe wishful thinking, in your scenario. Let us clarify. Comey, by his own admission, has no proof these latest batch of emails are incriminating, significant, or even new. How does this help inform the American people, except encourage rumor-mongering?

It is unbelievable that Comey would release old case documents due to a FOIA now. Together with the agents leaking to The Wall Street Journal I think he has lost control over his agency. Rather than lamenting all the resignations he should be asking for more of them. Who investigates the FBI?

So, how this was handled "will ultimately benefit the next president" *cough* Donald Trump *cough*.
And with the additional "Clinton file" release today is the FBI just dropping any pretense of being apolitical?
I used to look to Venezuela for banana-republic news.
Thank goodness there's some first-rate baseball on this week that I can watch instead.
Actually he better find something new to do.

"But F.B.I. agents, many of whom are strongly supportive of Mr. Comey and his approachable leadership style, have struggled to defend his decision. They acknowledge that he was in a bind, but say the backlash against the F.B.I. is unlike any in recent history."

Says a lot about the intelligence of the FBI that they cannot figure out why there is such a backlash and could not predict it would happen. We are in a lot of trouble to have such an incompetent bunch of people trying to protect us or so it would seem.
I agree ( so if you win Trump, please don't come for me first ... )

If Clinton is elected, the entire FBI will be politicized, as will all other branches of the Executive, with the instructions that, if they value their careers, the Clinton sleaze, past, present and future, is off limits. This might be the last chance for some truth to emerge. Thank you Comey for being a mensch.
What on earth suggested to you that Comey didn't see this backlash coming?
Except his letter was the opposite of transparent-it was both opaque and speculative.

But if someone who used to work for you, gives aanswers to ssomeone who currently works for you, but you didn't get them, are you still deserving of excoriation?

Basically, she's been ccondemned for the actions of her ex staff, her husband, her predecessor, her foundation staff, pretty much everything that she's actually "done" is pretty minute on the scale of what we find in the baggage of your aaverage politician.

I'm not going to attack people for accusations and assumptions anymore. II've never seen such a massive and long lasting smear campaign and I won't add to it.
Glad to hear someone else knows about Ernie Banks, who was Chicago's Willie Mays.

True, Chicagoans will not vote for Trump. But the owners of the Cubs gave $1 million to a Trump Super PAC. And, while Chicago's population is 32% African American, the faces in the crowd at Wrigley, like the faces in the crowd at a Trump rally, are almost 100% white.

I'm a military brat who has never been to Chicago, and a lifelong Cubs fan, starting in grade school, when I loved to watch Ernie Banks play on the old black and white TV.

Nothing wrong with Cleveland, but Ohio is the bad luck state these days, even if it doesn't end up voting for the orange atrocity. Chicago will always have the lake, the skyline, the truly tough. My friend Gene Barasch from college is from Chicago, and used to describe walking to school along Lake Michigan, hoping to arrive before his whole face went numb.

That adversity has shown itself to be good life training for Chicagoans. In the case of the Cubs, it wasn't so much that they were loveable losers as it was that people in Chicago are street smart. They know that a tradition of failure is not transferable to them, and even it were they would overcome it.

And it's also noteworthy that Chicagoans will not vote for Trump. Hillary carries Illinois for the same reason she will Pennsylvania: They know what obnoxious New Yorkers are all about. Hell, even New Yorkers can't stand him. It's the rest of the country that has so many of us worried.
I don't know, I think while Clinton might be a bad president, I'm not convinced Trump won't be our LAST president.
So, Mr. Comey, how does it feel to fall on your sword for Donald?

What crimes do you think she could have possibly committed? She has been investigated over and over for 30 years. Anyone who knows anything about the internet and emails knows that it is way more than likely that all the emails on Huma's laptop were duplicates of ones that have already been examined over and over and over. Hillary can't go to the bathroom without someone saying, "What is she trying to hide?"

Sec. Clinton will win this election and thank Mr. Comey afterwards. He has inspired many lazy Democrats to get up off the couch and head to the polls. We were getting complacent.

This ridiculous email fiasco will be put to bed once and for all as it should have been long ago. As for Mr. Trump? He will head back to the origin of his birth: Planet Hate.

The Republicans will obstruct in the House for another 4 years and then mount another useless campaign filled with anger and vitriol. And we will survive.
